ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Traumatic Tympanic Membrane Perforation (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of branch puncture, otalgia, tinnitus, and Type B tympanogram with large ear canal volume (4.8 mL).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular Discontinuity (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant conductive hearing loss and CT scan findings confirming discontinuity.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing sensitivity and type of loss given history of trauma.
Evaluate speech understanding and cross-check with pure-tone thresholds.
Assess middle ear function and tympanic membrane integrity.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear presents with a mild to moderately severe conductive hearing loss. Tympanometry in the right ear reveals a flat trace (Type B) with a large ear canal volume (4.8 mL), consistent with a tympanic membrane perforation. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. The left ear is within normal limits.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear mild conductive loss (250-2000 Hz) sloping to moderate/moderately severe (3000-4000 Hz); PTA 40 dB HL. Left ear normal hearing (PTA 7 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear SRT 45 dB HL, WRS 96% at 80 dB HL. Left ear SRT 5 dB HL, WRS 96% at 50 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear Type B (flat) with large ear canal volume (4.8 mL). Left ear Type A (normal) with volume 1.3 mL.

proposed_items: Referral to otologist for tympanoplasty and ossicular chain reconstruction
Use of hearing protection in noise
counseling_actions: Explain the conductive nature of the hearing loss and the presence of a tympanic membrane perforation
Discuss the CT scan findings of ossicular discontinuity
Advise to keep the right ear dry to prevent infection

escalation.rationale_short: Surgical management required for tympanic membrane repair and ossicular chain reconstruction.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing improvement post-surgery and annual surveillance.
